description: From Latin contrectātio, from Latin contrectāre (“to touch”).

entries.meaning: (medicine, law) The initial stage of the sexual act involving manual contact and tumescence; sexual foreplay.
examples: Most animals have no desire for contrectation. In man the impulse of contrectation is the more important. If the individual practises total abstinence, i. e., if he abstains even from the gratification of the impulse of contrectation, then ...
